page.title: 17WATER TREATMENT PLANT
page.content: A new water treatment plant is being built at the rear of Mossley Hollins High School, Huddersfield Rd., Mossley, and will be known as the Buckton Castle Water Treatment Works. The new scheme will supply a population of 122,000 in Delph, Diggle Dobcross, Uppermill and Greenfield in the Oldham M.B. and Ashton, Mossley, Stalybridge, Audenshaw and Droylsden in Tameside. These areas are at present supplied by four old plants called Yeoman Hey, Greenfield, Brushes and Swineshaw in the Greenfield and Swineshaw valleys built in the period 1909 -1912 with extensions in 1950. Some 50 megalitres of water a day will be treated to remove colour, iron,aluminium and manganese. The Buckton Castle plant will bring considerable improvements in the water supply to the area.
